Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֨שׁ אֵלָ֜יו יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיֹּאמֶר֮ בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִי֒ יְדַבֶּר־נָ֨א עַבְדְּךָ֤ דָבָר֙ בְּאָזְנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְאַל־יִ֥חַר אַפְּךָ֖ בְּעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י כָמ֖וֹךָ כְּפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyiggash ʾēlåv yehūdhåh vayyōʾmer bî ʾadhōnî yedhabber-nåʾ ʿavdekhå dhåvår beʾåznē ʾadhōnî veʾal-yiḥar ʾappekhå beʿavdekhå kî khåmōkhå kefarʿōh
English: Then Judah came near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord's ears, and let not thine anger burn against thy servant: for thou art even as Pharaoh.

Hebrew: אֲדֹנִ֣י שָׁאַ֔ל אֶת־עֲבָדָ֖יו לֵאמֹ֑ר הֲיֵשׁ־לָכֶ֥ם אָ֖ב אוֹ־אָֽח׃
Translit: ʾadhōnî shåʾal ʾeth-ʿavådhåv lēʾmōr hayēsh-låkhem ʾåv ʾō-ʾåḥ
English: My lord asked his servants, saying, Have ye a father, or a brother?

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֨אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י יֶשׁ־לָ֨נוּ֙ אָ֣ב זָקֵ֔ן וְיֶ֥לֶד זְקֻנִ֖ים קָטָ֑ן וְאָחִ֨יו מֵ֜ת וַיִּוָּתֵ֨ר ה֧וּא לְבַדּ֛וֹ לְאִמּ֖וֹ וְאָבִ֥יו אֲהֵבֽוֹ׃
Translit: vannōʾmer ʾel-ʾadhōnî yesh-lånū ʾåv zåqēn veyeledh zequnîm qåṭån veʾåḥîv mēth vayyivvåthēr hūʾ levaddō leʾimmō veʾåvîv ʾahēvō
English: And we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one; and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ הוֹרִדֻ֖הוּ אֵלָ֑י וְאָשִׂ֥ימָה עֵינִ֖י עָלָֽיו׃
Translit: vattōʾmer ʾel-ʿavådhekhå hōridhuhū ʾēlåi veʾåsîmåh ʿēnî ʿålåv
English: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Bring him down unto me, that I may set mine eyes upon him.

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֨אמֶר֙ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֔י לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל הַנַּ֖עַר לַעֲזֹ֣ב אֶת־אָבִ֑יו וְעָזַ֥ב אֶת־אָבִ֖יו וָמֵֽת׃
Translit: vannōʾmer ʾel-ʾadhōnî lōʾ-yūkhal hannaʿar laʿazōv ʾeth-ʾåvîv veʿåzav ʾeth-ʾåvîv våmēth
English: And we said unto my lord, The lad cannot leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר֙ אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ אִם־לֹ֥א יֵרֵ֛ד אֲחִיכֶ֥ם הַקָּטֹ֖ן אִתְּכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תֹסִפ֖וּן לִרְא֥וֹת פָּנָֽי׃
Translit: vattōʾmer ʾel-ʿavådhekhå ʾim-lōʾ yērēdh ʾaḥîkhem haqqåṭōn ʾittekhem lōʾ thōsifūn lirʾōth pånåi
English: And thou saidst unto thy servants, Except your youngest brother come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֙ כִּ֣י עָלִ֔ינוּ אֶֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֖ אָבִ֑י וַנַּ֨גֶּד־ל֔וֹ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי׃
Translit: vayhî kî ʿålînū ʾel-ʿavdekhå ʾåvî vannaggedh-lō ʾēth divrē ʾadhōnî
English: And it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָבִ֑ינוּ שֻׁ֖בוּ שִׁבְרוּ־לָ֥נוּ מְעַט־אֹֽכֶל׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾåvînū shuvū shivrū-lånū meʿaṭ-ʾōkhel
English: And our father said, Go again, and buy us a little food.

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֕אמֶר לֹ֥א נוּכַ֖ל לָרֶ֑דֶת אִם־יֵשׁ֩ אָחִ֨ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֤ן אִתָּ֨נוּ֙ וְיָרַ֔דְנוּ כִּי־לֹ֣א נוּכַ֗ל לִרְאוֹת֙ פְּנֵ֣י הָאִ֔ישׁ וְאָחִ֥ינוּ הַקָּטֹ֖ן אֵינֶ֥נּוּ אִתָּֽנוּ׃
Translit: vannōʾmer lōʾ nūkhal låredheth ʾim-yēsh ʾåḥînū haqqåṭōn ʾittånū veyåradhnū kî-lōʾ nūkhal lirʾōth penē håʾîsh veʾåḥînū haqqåṭōn ʾēnennū ʾittånū
English: And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man's face, except our youngest brother be with us.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֖י אֵלֵ֑ינוּ אַתֶּ֣ם יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם כִּ֥י שְׁנַ֖יִם יָֽלְדָה־לִּ֥י אִשְׁתִּֽי׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʿavdekhå ʾåvî ʾēlēnū ʾattem yedhaʿtem kî shenayim yåldhåh-lî ʾishtî
English: And thy servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife bare me two sons:

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א הָֽאֶחָד֙ מֵֽאִתִּ֔י וָאֹמַ֕ר אַ֖ךְ טָרֹ֣ף טֹרָ֑ף וְלֹ֥א רְאִיתִ֖יו עַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
Translit: vayyētṣēʾ håʾeḥådh mēʾittî våʾōmar ʾakh ṭårōf ṭōråf velōʾ reʾîthîv ʿadh-hēnnåh
English: And the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in pieces; and I saw him not since:

Hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֧ם גַּם־אֶת־זֶ֛ה מֵעִ֥ם פָּנַ֖י וְקָרָ֣הוּ אָס֑וֹן וְהֽוֹרַדְתֶּ֧ם אֶת־שֵׂיבָתִ֛י בְּרָעָ֖ה שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
Translit: ūleqaḥtem gam-ʾeth-zeh mēʿim pånai veqåråhū ʾåsōn vehōradhtem ʾeth-sēvåthî beråʿåh sheʾōlåh
English: And if ye take this also from me, and mischief befall him, ye shall bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כְּבֹאִי֙ אֶל־עַבְדְּךָ֣ אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹ קְשׁוּרָ֥ה בְנַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translit: veʿattåh kevōʾî ʾel-ʿavdekhå ʾåvî vehannaʿar ʾēnennū ʾittånū venafshō qeshūråh venafshō
English: Now therefore when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad be not with us; seeing that his life is bound up in the lad's life;

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּרְאוֹת֛וֹ כִּי־אֵ֥ין הַנַּ֖עַר וָמֵ֑ת וְהוֹרִ֨ידוּ עֲבָדֶ֜יךָ אֶת־שֵׂיבַ֨ת עַבְדְּךָ֥ אָבִ֛ינוּ בְּיָג֖וֹן שְׁאֹֽלָה׃
Translit: vehåyåh kirʾōthō kî-ʾēn hannaʿar våmēth vehōrîdhū ʿavådhekhå ʾeth-sēvath ʿavdekhå ʾåvînū beyåghōn sheʾōlåh
English: It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants shall bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father with sorrow to the grave.

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עַבְדְּךָ֙ עָרַ֣ב אֶת־הַנַּ֔עַר מֵעִ֥ם אָבִ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־לֹ֤א אֲבִיאֶ֨נּוּ֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְחָטָ֥אתִי לְאָבִ֖י כָּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translit: kî ʿavdekhå ʿårav ʾeth-hannaʿar mēʿim ʾåvî lēʾmōr ʾim-lōʾ ʾavîʾennū ʾēlekhå veḥåṭåʾthî leʾåvî kål-hayyåmîm
English: For thy servant became surety for the lad unto my father, saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame to my father for ever.

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה יֵֽשֶׁב־נָ֤א עַבְדְּךָ֙ תַּ֣חַת הַנַּ֔עַר עֶ֖בֶד לַֽאדֹנִ֑י וְהַנַּ֖עַר יַ֥עַל עִם־אֶחָֽיו׃
Translit: veʿattåh yēshev-nåʾ ʿavdekhå taḥath hannaʿar ʿevedh laʾdhōnî vehannaʿar yaʿal ʿim-ʾeḥåv
English: Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with his brethren.

Hebrew: כִּי־אֵיךְ֙ אֶֽעֱלֶ֣ה אֶל־אָבִ֔י וְהַנַּ֖עַר אֵינֶ֣נּוּ אִתִּ֑י פֶּ֚ן אֶרְאֶ֣ה בָרָ֔ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִמְצָ֖א אֶת־אָבִֽי׃
Translit: kî-ʾēkh ʾeʿeleh ʾel-ʾåvî vehannaʿar ʾēnennū ʾittî pen ʾerʾeh våråʿ ʾasher yimtṣåʾ ʾeth-ʾåvî
English: For how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest peradventure I see the evil that shall come on my father.

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יָכֹ֨ל יוֹסֵ֜ף לְהִתְאַפֵּ֗ק לְכֹ֤ל הַנִּצָּבִים֙ עָלָ֔יו וַיִּקְרָ֕א הוֹצִ֥יאוּ כָל־אִ֖ישׁ מֵעָלָ֑י וְלֹא־עָ֤מַד אִישׁ֙ אִתּ֔וֹ בְּהִתְוַדַּ֥ע יוֹסֵ֖ף אֶל־אֶחָֽיו׃
Translit: velōʾ-yåkhōl yōsēf lehithʾappēq lekhōl hannitṣṣåvîm ʿålåv vayyiqråʾ hōtṣîʾū khål-ʾîsh mēʿålåi velōʾ-ʿåmadh ʾîsh ʾittō behithvaddaʿ yōsēf ʾel-ʾeḥåv
English: Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him; and he cried, Cause every man to go out from me. And there stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known unto his brethren.

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ בִּבְכִ֑י וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע בֵּ֥ית פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyittēn ʾeth-qōlō bivkhî vayyishmeʿū mitṣrayim vayyishmaʿ bēth parʿōh
English: And he wept aloud: and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ אֲנִ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף הַע֥וֹד אָבִ֖י חָ֑י וְלֹֽא־יָכְל֤וּ אֶחָיו֙ לַעֲנ֣וֹת אֹת֔וֹ כִּ֥י נִבְהֲל֖וּ מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yōsēf ʾel-ʾeḥåv ʾanî yōsēf haʿōdh ʾåvî ḥåi velōʾ-yåkhlū ʾeḥåv laʿanōth ʾōthō kî nivhalū mippånåv
English: And Joseph said unto his brethren, I am Joseph; doth my father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֧ף אֶל־אֶחָ֛יו גְּשׁוּ־נָ֥א אֵלַ֖י וַיִּגָּ֑שׁוּ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֲנִי֙ יוֹסֵ֣ף אֲחִיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־מְכַרְתֶּ֥ם אֹתִ֖י מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yōsēf ʾel-ʾeḥåv geshū-nåʾ ʾēlai vayyiggåshū vayyōʾmer ʾanî yōsēf ʾaḥîkhem ʾasher-mekhartem ʾōthî mitṣråymåh
English: And Joseph said unto his brethren, Come near to me, I pray you. And they came near. And he said, I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה אַל־תֵּעָ֣צְב֗וּ וְאַל־יִ֨חַר֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־מְכַרְתֶּ֥ם אֹתִ֖י הֵ֑נָּה כִּ֣י לְמִֽחְיָ֔ה שְׁלָחַ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֖ים לִפְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: veʿattåh ʾal-tēʿåtṣvū veʾal-yiḥar beʿēnēkhem kî-mekhartem ʾōthî hēnnåh kî lemiḥyåh shelåḥanî ʾelōhîm lifnēkhem
English: Now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve life.

Hebrew: כִּי־זֶ֛ה שְׁנָתַ֥יִם הָרָעָ֖ב בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעוֹד֙ חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־חָרִ֖ישׁ וְקָצִּֽיר׃
Translit: kî-zeh shenåthayim håråʿåv beqerev håʾåretṣ veʿōdh ḥåmēsh shånîm ʾasher ʾēn-ḥårîsh veqåtṣṣîr
English: For these two years hath the famine been in the land: and yet there are five years, in the which there shall neither be earing nor harvest.

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהִים֙ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם לָשׂ֥וּם לָכֶ֛ם שְׁאֵרִ֖ית בָּאָ֑רֶץ וּלְהַחֲי֣וֹת לָכֶ֔ם לִפְלֵיטָ֖ה גְּדֹלָֽה׃
Translit: vayyishlåḥēnî ʾelōhîm lifnēkhem låsūm låkhem sheʾērîth båʾåretṣ ūlehaḥaiōth låkhem liflēṭåh gedhōlåh
English: And God sent me before you to preserve you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה לֹֽא־אַתֶּ֞ם שְׁלַחְתֶּ֤ם אֹתִי֙ הֵ֔נָּה כִּ֖י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיְשִׂימֵ֨נִֽי לְאָ֜ב לְפַרְעֹ֗ה וּלְאָדוֹן֙ לְכָל־בֵּית֔וֹ וּמֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּכָל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: veʿattåh lōʾ-ʾattem shelaḥtem ʾōthî hēnnåh kî håʾelōhîm vaysîmēnî leʾåv lefarʿōh ūleʾådhōn lekhål-bēthō ūmōshēl bekhål-ʾeretṣ mitṣråyim
English: So now it was not you that sent me hither, but God: and he hath made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and a ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.

Hebrew: מַהֲרוּ֮ וַעֲל֣וּ אֶל־אָבִי֒ וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֣ם אֵלָ֗יו כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ בִּנְךָ֣ יוֹסֵ֔ף שָׂמַ֧נִי אֱלֹהִ֛ים לְאָד֖וֹן לְכָל־מִצְרָ֑יִם רְדָ֥ה אֵלַ֖י אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹֽד׃
Translit: maharū vaʿalū ʾel-ʾåvî vaʾamartem ʾēlåv kōh ʾåmar binkhå yōsēf såmanî ʾelōhîm leʾådhōn lekhål-mitṣråyim redhåh ʾēlai ʾal-taʿamōdh
English: Haste ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt: come down unto me, tarry not:

Hebrew: וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֣ בְאֶֽרֶץ־גֹּ֗שֶׁן וְהָיִ֤יתָ קָרוֹב֙ אֵלַ֔י אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֖יךָ וּבְנֵ֣י בָנֶ֑יךָ וְצֹאנְךָ֥ וּבְקָרְךָ֖ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
Translit: veyåshavtå veʾeretṣ-gōshen vehåyîthå qårōv ʾēlai ʾattåh ūvånekhå ūvenē vånekhå vetṣōʾnekhå ūveqårkhå vekhål-ʾasher-låkh
English: And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and thou shalt be near unto me, thou, and thy children, and thy children's children, and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast:

Hebrew: וְכִלְכַּלְתִּ֤י אֹֽתְךָ֙ שָׁ֔ם כִּי־ע֛וֹד חָמֵ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים רָעָ֑ב פֶּן־תִּוָּרֵ֛שׁ אַתָּ֥ה וּבֵֽיתְךָ֖ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־לָֽךְ׃
Translit: vekhilkaltî ʾōthekhå shåm kî-ʿōdh ḥåmēsh shånîm råʿåv pen-tivvårēsh ʾattåh ūvēthekhå vekhål-ʾasher-låkh
English: And there will I nourish thee; for yet there are five years of famine; lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty.

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֤ה עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ רֹא֔וֹת וְעֵינֵ֖י אָחִ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ין כִּי־פִ֖י הַֽמְדַבֵּ֥ר אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translit: vehinnēh ʿēnēkhem rōʾōth veʿēnē ʾåḥî vinyåmîn kî-fî hamdhabbēr ʾalēkhem
English: And, behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you.

Hebrew: וְהִגַּדְתֶּ֣ם לְאָבִ֗י אֶת־כָּל־כְּבוֹדִי֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר רְאִיתֶ֑ם וּמִֽהַרְתֶּ֛ם וְהוֹרַדְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־אָבִ֖י הֵֽנָּה׃
Translit: vehiggadhtem leʾåvî ʾeth-kål-kevōdhî bemitṣrayim veʾēth kål-ʾasher reʾîthem ūmihartem vehōradhtem ʾeth-ʾåvî hēnnåh
English: And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen; and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither.

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֛ל עַל־צַוְּארֵ֥י בִנְיָמִֽן־אָחִ֖יו וַיֵּ֑בְךְּ וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן בָּכָ֖ה עַל־צַוָּארָֽיו׃
Translit: vayyippōl ʿal-tṣavveʾrē vinyåmin-ʾåḥîv vayyēvek ūvinyåmin båkhåh ʿal-tṣavvåʾråv
English: And he fell upon his brother Benjamin's neck, and wept; and Benjamin wept upon his neck.

Hebrew: וַיְנַשֵּׁ֥ק לְכָל־אֶחָ֖יו וַיֵּ֣בְךְּ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְאַ֣חֲרֵי כֵ֔ן דִּבְּר֥וּ אֶחָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vaynasshēq lekhål-ʾeḥåv vayyēvek ʿalēhem veʾaḥarē khēn dibberū ʾeḥåv ʾittō
English: Moreover he kissed all his brethren, and wept upon them: and after that his brethren talked with him.

Hebrew: וְהַקֹּ֣ל נִשְׁמַ֗ע בֵּ֤ית פַּרְעֹה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּ֖אוּ אֲחֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֑ף וַיִּיטַב֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֔ה וּבְעֵינֵ֖י עֲבָדָֽיו׃
Translit: vehaqqōl nishmaʿ bēth parʿōh lēʾmōr båʾū ʾaḥē yōsēf vayyîṭav beʿēnē farʿōh ūveʿēnē ʿavådhåv
English: And the fame thereof was heard in Pharaoh's house, saying, Joseph's brethren are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his servants.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר פַּרְעֹה֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף אֱמֹ֥ר אֶל־אַחֶ֖יךָ זֹ֣את עֲשׂ֑וּ טַֽעֲנוּ֙ אֶת־בְּעִ֣ירְכֶ֔ם וּלְכוּ־בֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer parʿōh ʾel-yōsēf ʾemōr ʾel-ʾaḥekhå zōʾth ʿasū ṭaʿanū ʾeth-beʿîrekhem ūlekhū-vōʾū ʾartṣåh kenåʿan
English: And Pharaoh said unto Joseph, Say unto thy brethren, This do ye; lade your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of Canaan;

Hebrew: וּקְח֧וּ אֶת־אֲבִיכֶ֛ם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּיכֶ֖ם וּבֹ֣אוּ אֵלָ֑י וְאֶתְּנָ֣ה לָכֶ֗ם אֶת־טוּב֙ אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וְאִכְל֖וּ אֶת־חֵ֥לֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translit: ūqeḥū ʾeth-ʾavîkhem veʾeth-båttēkhem ūvōʾū ʾēlåi veʾettenåh låkhem ʾeth-ṭūv ʾeretṣ mitṣrayim veʾikhlū ʾeth-ḥēlev håʾåretṣ
English: And take your father and your households, and come unto me: and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of the land.

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה צֻוֵּ֖יתָה זֹ֣את עֲשׂ֑וּ קְחוּ־לָכֶם֩ מֵאֶ֨רֶץ מִצְרַ֜יִם עֲגָל֗וֹת לְטַפְּכֶם֙ וְלִנְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם וּנְשָׂאתֶ֥ם אֶת־אֲבִיכֶ֖ם וּבָאתֶֽם׃
Translit: veʾattåh tṣuvvēthåh zōʾth ʿasū qeḥū-låkhem mēʾeretṣ mitṣrayim ʿaghålōth leṭappekhem velinshēkhem ūnesåʾthem ʾeth-ʾavîkhem ūvåʾthem
English: Now thou art commanded, this do ye; take you wagons out of the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.

Hebrew: וְעֵ֣ינְכֶ֔ם אַל־תָּחֹ֖ס עַל־כְּלֵיכֶ֑ם כִּי־ט֛וּב כָּל־אֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לָכֶ֥ם הֽוּא׃
Translit: veʿēnekhem ʾal-tåḥōs ʿal-kelēkhem kî-ṭūv kål-ʾeretṣ mitṣrayim låkhem hūʾ
English: Also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of Egypt is your's.

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֥ם יוֹסֵ֛ף עֲגָל֖וֹת עַל־פִּ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֥ן לָהֶ֛ם צֵדָ֖ה לַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translit: vayyaʿasū-khēn benē yisråʾēl vayyittēn låhem yōsēf ʿaghålōth ʿal-pî farʿōh vayyittēn låhem tṣēdhåh laddårekh
English: And the children of Israel did so: and Joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way.

Hebrew: לְכֻלָּ֥ם נָתַ֛ן לָאִ֖ישׁ חֲלִפ֣וֹת שְׂמָלֹ֑ת וּלְבִנְיָמִ֤ן נָתַן֙ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ מֵא֣וֹת כֶּ֔סֶף וְחָמֵ֖שׁ חֲלִפֹ֥ת שְׂמָלֹֽת׃
Translit: lekhullåm nåthan låʾîsh ḥalifōth semålōth ūlevinyåmin nåthan shelōsh mēʾōth kesef veḥåmēsh ḥalifōth semålōth
English: To all of them he gave each man changes of raiment; but to Benjamin he gave three hundred pieces of silver, and five changes of raiment.

Hebrew: וּלְאָבִ֞יו שָׁלַ֤ח כְּזֹאת֙ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה חֲמֹרִ֔ים נֹשְׂאִ֖ים מִטּ֣וּב מִצְרָ֑יִם וְעֶ֣שֶׂר אֲתֹנֹ֡ת נֹֽ֠שְׂאֹת בָּ֣ר וָלֶ֧חֶם וּמָז֛וֹן לְאָבִ֖יו לַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translit: ūleʾåvîv shålaḥ kezōʾth ʿasåråh ḥamōrîm nōseʾîm miṭṭūv mitṣråyim veʿeser ʾathōnōth nōseʾōth bår våleḥem ūmåzōn leʾåvîv laddårekh
English: And to his father he sent after this manner; ten asses laden with the good things of Egypt, and ten she asses laden with corn and bread and meat for his father by the way.

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־אֶחָ֖יו וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אַֽל־תִּרְגְּז֖וּ בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translit: vayshallaḥ ʾeth-ʾeḥåv vayyēlēkhū vayyōʾmer ʾalēhem ʾal-tirgezū baddårekh
English: So he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said unto them, See that ye fall not out by the way.

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ֙ אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyaʿalū mimmitṣråyim vayyåvōʾū ʾeretṣ kenaʿan ʾel-yaʿaqōv ʾavîhem
English: And they went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan unto Jacob their father,

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֨דוּ ל֜וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר ע֚וֹד יוֹסֵ֣ף חַ֔י וְכִֽי־ה֥וּא מֹשֵׁ֖ל בְּכָל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וַיָּ֣פָג לִבּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י לֹא־הֶאֱמִ֖ין לָהֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyaggidhū lō lēʾmōr ʿōdh yōsēf ḥai vekhî-hūʾ mōshēl bekhål-ʾeretṣ mitṣråyim vayyåfågh libbō kî lōʾ-heʾemîn låhem
English: And told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive, and he is governor over all the land of Egypt. And Jacob's heart fainted, for he believed them not.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו אֵ֣ת כָּל־דִּבְרֵ֤י יוֹסֵף֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֲגָל֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח יוֹסֵ֖ף לָשֵׂ֣את אֹת֑וֹ וַתְּחִ֕י ר֖וּחַ יַעֲקֹ֥ב אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
Translit: vaydhabberū ʾēlåv ʾēth kål-divrē yōsēf ʾasher dibber ʾalēhem vayyarʾ ʾeth-håʿaghålōth ʾasher-shålaḥ yōsēf låsēʾth ʾōthō vatteḥî rūaḥ yaʿaqōv ʾavîhem
English: And they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said unto them: and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived:

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רַ֛ב עוֹד־יוֹסֵ֥ף בְּנִ֖י חָ֑י אֵֽלְכָ֥ה וְאֶרְאֶ֖נּוּ בְּטֶ֥רֶם אָמֽוּת׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yisråʾēl rav ʿōdh-yōsēf benî ḥåi ʾēlekhåh veʾerʾennū beṭerem ʾåmūth
English: And Israel said, It is enough; Joseph my son is yet alive: I will go and see him before I die.

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֤ע יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֖א בְּאֵ֣רָה שָּׁ֑בַע וַיִּזְבַּ֣ח זְבָחִ֔ים לֵאלֹהֵ֖י אָבִ֥יו יִצְחָֽק׃
Translit: vayyissaʿ yisråʾēl vekhål-ʾasher-lō vayyåvōʾ beʾēråh shåvaʿ vayyizbaḥ zevåḥîm lēʾlōhē ʾåvîv yitṣḥåq
English: And Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to Beer-sheba, and offered sacrifices unto the God of his father Isaac.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֱלֹהִ֤ים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּמַרְאֹ֣ת הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר יַעֲקֹ֣ב יַעֲקֹ֑ב וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾelōhîm leyisråʾēl bemarʾōth hallaylåh vayyōʾmer yaʿaqōv yaʿaqōv vayyōʾmer hinnēnî
English: And God spake unto Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob. And he said, Here am I.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אָנֹכִ֥י הָאֵ֖ל אֱלֹהֵ֣י אָבִ֑יךָ אַל־תִּירָא֙ מֵרְדָ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יְמָה כִּֽי־לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל אֲשִֽׂימְךָ֥ שָֽׁם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer ʾånōkhî håʾēl ʾelōhē ʾåvîkhå ʾal-tîråʾ mēredhåh mitṣraymåh kî-leghōy gådhōl ʾasîmekhå shåm
English: And he said, I am God, the God of thy father: fear not to go down into Egypt; for I will there make of thee a great nation:

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֗י אֵרֵ֤ד עִמְּךָ֙ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה וְאָנֹכִ֖י אַֽעַלְךָ֣ גַם־עָלֹ֑ה וְיוֹסֵ֕ף יָשִׁ֥ית יָד֖וֹ עַל־עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: ʾånōkhî ʾērēdh ʿimmekhå mitṣraymåh veʾånōkhî ʾaʿalkhå gham-ʿålōh veyōsēf yåshîth yådhō ʿal-ʿēnekhå
English: I will go down with thee into Egypt; and I will also surely bring thee up again: and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קָם יַעֲקֹ֖ב מִבְּאֵ֣ר שָׁ֑בַע וַיִּשְׂא֨וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־יַעֲקֹ֣ב אֲבִיהֶ֗ם וְאֶת־טַפָּם֙ וְאֶת־נְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם בָּעֲגָל֕וֹת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח פַּרְעֹ֖ה לָשֵׂ֥את אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyåqåm yaʿaqōv mibbeʾēr shåvaʿ vayyisʾū venē-yisråʾēl ʾeth-yaʿaqōv ʾavîhem veʾeth-ṭappåm veʾeth-neshēhem båʿaghålōth ʾasher-shålaḥ parʿōh låsēʾth ʾōthō
English: And Jacob rose up from Beer-sheba: and the sons of Israel carried Jacob their father, and their little ones, and their wives, in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶ֗ם וְאֶת־רְכוּשָׁם֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר רָֽכְשׁוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ מִצְרָ֑יְמָה יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְכָל־זַרְע֥וֹ אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translit: vayyiqḥū ʾeth-miqnēhem veʾeth-rekhūshåm ʾasher råkhshū beʾeretṣ kenaʿan vayyåvōʾū mitṣråymåh yaʿaqōv vekhål-zarʿō ʾittō
English: And they took their cattle, and their goods, which they had gotten in the land of Canaan, and came into Egypt, Jacob, and all his seed with him:

Hebrew: בָּנָ֞יו וּבְנֵ֤י בָנָיו֙ אִתּ֔וֹ בְּנֹתָ֛יו וּבְנ֥וֹת בָּנָ֖יו וְכָל־זַרְע֑וֹ הֵבִ֥יא אִתּ֖וֹ מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translit: bånåv ūvenē vånåv ʾittō benōthåv ūvenōth bånåv vekhål-zarʿō hēvîʾ ʾittō mitṣråymåh
English: His sons, and his sons' sons with him, his daughters, and his sons' daughters, and all his seed brought he with him into Egypt.

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה שְׁמ֧וֹת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל הַבָּאִ֥ים מִצְרַ֖יְמָה יַעֲקֹ֣ב וּבָנָ֑יו בְּכֹ֥ר יַעֲקֹ֖ב רְאוּבֵֽן׃
Translit: veʾēlleh shemōth benē-yisråʾēl habbåʾîm mitṣraymåh yaʿaqōv ūvånåv bekhōr yaʿaqōv reʾūvēn
English: And these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt, Jacob and his sons: Reuben, Jacob's firstborn.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י רְאוּבֵ֑ן חֲנ֥וֹךְ וּפַלּ֖וּא וְחֶצְר֥וֹן וְכַרְמִֽי׃
Translit: ūvenē reʾūvēn ḥanōkh ūfallūʾ veḥetṣrōn vekharmî
English: And the sons of Reuben; Hanoch, and Phallu, and Hezron, and Carmi.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֗וֹן יְמוּאֵ֧ל וְיָמִ֛ין וְאֹ֖הַד וְיָכִ֣ין וְצֹ֑חַר וְשָׁא֖וּל בֶּן־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִֽית׃
Translit: ūvenē shimʿōn yemūʾēl veyåmîn veʾōhadh veyåkhîn vetṣōḥar veshåʾūl ben-hakkenaʿanîth
English: And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י לֵוִ֑י גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן קְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃
Translit: ūvenē lēvî gēreshōn qehåth ūmerårî
English: And the sons of Levi; Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה עֵ֧ר וְאוֹנָ֛ן וְשֵׁלָ֖ה וָפֶ֣רֶץ וָזָ֑רַח וַיָּ֨מָת עֵ֤ר וְאוֹנָן֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־פֶ֖רֶץ חֶצְר֥וֹן וְחָמֽוּל׃
Translit: ūvenē yehūdhåh ʿēr veʾōnån veshēlåh våferetṣ våzåraḥ vayyåmåth ʿēr veʾōnån beʾeretṣ kenaʿan vayyihyū venē-feretṣ ḥetṣrōn veḥåmūl
English: And the sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah, and Pharez, and Zerah: but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And the sons of Pharez were Hezron and Hamul.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יִשָׂשכָ֑ר תּוֹלָ֥ע וּפֻוָּ֖ה וְי֥וֹב וְשִׁמְרֽוֹן׃
Translit: ūvenē yisåshkhår tōlåʿ ūfuvvåh veyōv veshimrōn
English: And the sons of Issachar; Tola, and Phuvah, and Job, and Shimron.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י זְבוּלֻ֑ן סֶ֥רֶד וְאֵל֖וֹן וְיַחְלְאֵֽל׃
Translit: ūvenē zevūlun seredh veʾēlōn veyaḥleʾēl
English: And the sons of Zebulun; Sered, and Elon, and Jahleel.

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י לֵאָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָֽלְדָ֤ה לְיַעֲקֹב֙ בְּפַדַּ֣ן אֲרָ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת דִּינָ֣ה בִתּ֑וֹ כָּל־נֶ֧פֶשׁ בָּנָ֛יו וּבְנוֹתָ֖יו שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשָׁלֹֽשׁ׃
Translit: ʾēlleh benē lēʾåh ʾasher yåldhåh leyaʿaqōv befaddan ʾaråm veʾēth dînåh vittō kål-nefesh bånåv ūvenōthåv shelōshîm veshålōsh
English: These be the sons of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob in Padan-aram, with his daughter Dinah: all the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty and three.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י גָ֔ד צִפְי֥וֹן וְחַגִּ֖י שׁוּנִ֣י וְאֶצְבֹּ֑ן עֵרִ֥י וַֽאֲרוֹדִ֖י וְאַרְאֵלִֽי׃
Translit: ūvenē ghådh tṣifyōn veḥaggî shūnî veʾetṣbōn ʿērî vaʾarōdhî veʾarʾēlî
English: And the sons of Gad; Ziphion, and Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֗ר יִמְנָ֧ה וְיִשְׁוָ֛ה וְיִשְׁוִ֥י וּבְרִיעָ֖ה וְשֶׂ֣רַח אֲחֹתָ֑ם וּבְנֵ֣י בְרִיעָ֔ה חֶ֖בֶר וּמַלְכִּיאֵֽל׃
Translit: ūvenē ʾåshēr yimnåh veyishvåh veyishvî ūverîʿåh veseraḥ ʾaḥōthåm ūvenē verîʿåh ḥever ūmalkîʾēl
English: And the sons of Asher; Jimnah, and Ishuah, and Isui, and Beriah, and Serah their sister: and the sons of Beriah; Heber, and Malchiel.

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י זִלְפָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָבָ֖ן לְלֵאָ֣ה בִתּ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֤לֶד אֶת־אֵ֨לֶּה֙ לְיַעֲקֹ֔ב שֵׁ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translit: ʾēlleh benē zilpåh ʾasher-nåthan låvån lelēʾåh vittō vattēledh ʾeth-ʾēlleh leyaʿaqōv shēsh ʿesrēh nåfesh
English: These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter, and these she bare unto Jacob, even sixteen souls.

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י רָחֵל֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב יוֹסֵ֖ף וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
Translit: benē råḥēl ʾēsheth yaʿaqōv yōsēf ūvinyåmin
English: The sons of Rachel Jacob's wife; Joseph, and Benjamin.

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּלֵ֣ד לְיוֹסֵף֮ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַיִם֒ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָֽלְדָה־לּוֹ֙ אָֽסְנַ֔ת בַּת־פּ֥וֹטִי פֶ֖רַע כֹּהֵ֣ן אֹ֑ן אֶת־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translit: vayyivvålēdh leyōsēf beʾeretṣ mitṣrayim ʾasher yåldhåh-lō ʾåsnath bath-pōṭî feraʿ kōhēn ʾōn ʾeth-menassheh veʾeth-ʾefråyim
English: And unto Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, which Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah priest of On bare unto him.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֗ן בֶּ֤לַע וָבֶ֨כֶר֙ וְאַשְׁבֵּ֔ל גֵּרָ֥א וְנַעֲמָ֖ן אֵחִ֣י וָרֹ֑אשׁ מֻפִּ֥ים וְחֻפִּ֖ים וָאָֽרְדְּ׃
Translit: ūvenē vinyåmin belaʿ våvekher veʾashbēl gēråʾ venaʿamån ʾēḥî vårōʾsh muppîm veḥuppîm våʾård
English: And the sons of Benjamin were Belah, and Becher, and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard.

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י רָחֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֻלַּ֖ד לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב כָּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃
Translit: ʾēlleh benē råḥēl ʾasher yulladh leyaʿaqōv kål-nefesh ʾarbåʿåh ʿåsår
English: These are the sons of Rachel, which were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי־דָ֖ן חֻשִֽׁים׃
Translit: ūvenē-dhån ḥushîm
English: And the sons of Dan; Hushim.

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י נַפְתָּלִ֑י יַחְצְאֵ֥ל וְגוּנִ֖י וְיֵ֥צֶר וְשִׁלֵּֽם׃
Translit: ūvenē naftålî yaḥtṣeʾēl veghūnî veyētṣer veshillēm
English: And the sons of Naphtali; Jahzeel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shillem.

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י בִלְהָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָבָ֖ן לְרָחֵ֣ל בִּתּ֑וֹ וַתֵּ֧לֶד אֶת־אֵ֛לֶּה לְיַעֲקֹ֖ב כָּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ שִׁבְעָֽה׃
Translit: ʾēlleh benē vilhåh ʾasher-nåthan låvån leråḥēl bittō vattēledh ʾeth-ʾēlleh leyaʿaqōv kål-nefesh shivʿåh
English: These are the sons of Bilhah, which Laban gave unto Rachel his daughter, and she bare these unto Jacob: all the souls were seven.

Hebrew: כָּל־הַ֠נֶּפֶשׁ הַבָּאָ֨ה לְיַעֲקֹ֤ב מִצְרַ֨יְמָה֙ יֹצְאֵ֣י יְרֵכ֔וֹ מִלְּבַ֖ד נְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵי־יַעֲקֹ֑ב כָּל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וָשֵֽׁשׁ׃
Translit: kål-hannefesh habbåʾåh leyaʿaqōv mitṣraymåh yōtṣeʾē yerēkhō millevadh neshē venē-yaʿaqōv kål-nefesh shisshîm våshēsh
English: All the souls that came with Jacob into Egypt, which came out of his loins, besides Jacob's sons' wives, all the souls were threescore and six;

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יוֹסֵ֛ף אֲשֶׁר־יֻלַּד־ל֥וֹ בְמִצְרַ֖יִם נֶ֣פֶשׁ שְׁנָ֑יִם כָּל־הַנֶּ֧פֶשׁ לְבֵֽית־יַעֲקֹ֛ב הַבָּ֥אָה מִצְרַ֖יְמָה שִׁבְעִֽים׃
Translit: ūvenē yōsēf ʾasher-yulladh-lō vemitṣrayim nefesh shenåyim kål-hannefesh levēth-yaʿaqōv habbåʾåh mitṣraymåh shivʿîm
English: And the sons of Joseph, which were born him in Egypt, were two souls: all the souls of the house of Jacob, which came into Egypt, were threescore and ten.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־יְהוּדָ֞ה שָׁלַ֤ח לְפָנָיו֙ אֶל־יוֹסֵ֔ף לְהוֹרֹ֥ת לְפָנָ֖יו גֹּ֑שְׁנָה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אַ֥רְצָה גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: veʾeth-yehūdhåh shålaḥ lefånåv ʾel-yōsēf lehōrōth lefånåv gōshenåh vayyåvōʾū ʾartṣåh gōshen
English: And he sent Judah before him unto Joseph, to direct his face unto Goshen; and they came into the land of Goshen.

Hebrew: וַיֶּאְסֹ֤ר יוֹסֵף֙ מֶרְכַּבְתּ֔וֹ וַיַּ֛עַל לִקְרַֽאת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אָבִ֖יו גֹּ֑שְׁנָה וַיֵּרָ֣א אֵלָ֗יו וַיִּפֹּל֙ עַל־צַוָּארָ֔יו וַיֵּ֥בְךְּ עַל־צַוָּארָ֖יו עֽוֹד׃
Translit: vayyeʾsōr yōsēf merkavtō vayyaʿal liqraʾth-yisråʾēl ʾåvîv gōshenåh vayyēråʾ ʾēlåv vayyippōl ʿal-tṣavvåʾråv vayyēvek ʿal-tṣavvåʾråv ʿōdh
English: And Joseph made ready his chariot, and went up to meet Israel his father, to Goshen, and presented himself unto him; and he fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף אָמ֣וּתָה הַפָּ֑עַם אַחֲרֵי֙ רְאוֹתִ֣י אֶת־פָּנֶ֔יךָ כִּ֥י עוֹדְךָ֖ חָֽי׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yisråʾēl ʾel-yōsēf ʾåmūthåh happåʿam ʾaḥarē reʾōthî ʾeth-pånekhå kî ʿōdhekhå ḥåi
English: And Israel said unto Joseph, Now let me die, since I have seen thy face, because thou art yet alive.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹסֵ֤ף אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ וְאֶל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יו אֶעֱלֶ֖ה וְאַגִּ֣ידָה לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאֹֽמְרָ֣ה אֵלָ֔יו אַחַ֧י וּבֵית־אָבִ֛י אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־כְּנַ֖עַן בָּ֥אוּ אֵלָֽי׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yōsēf ʾel-ʾeḥåv veʾel-bēth ʾåvîv ʾeʿeleh veʾaggîdhåh lefarʿōh veʾōmeråh ʾēlåv ʾaḥai ūvēth-ʾåvî ʾasher beʾeretṣ-kenaʿan båʾū ʾēlåi
English: And Joseph said unto his brethren, and unto his father's house, I will go up, and shew Pharaoh, and say unto him, My brethren, and my father's house, which were in the land of Canaan, are come unto me;

Hebrew: וְהָאֲנָשִׁים֙ רֹ֣עֵי צֹ֔אן כִּֽי־אַנְשֵׁ֥י מִקְנֶ֖ה הָי֑וּ וְצֹאנָ֧ם וּבְקָרָ֛ם וְכָל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם הֵבִֽיאוּ׃
Translit: vehåʾanåshîm rōʿē tṣōʾn kî-ʾanshē miqneh håiū vetṣōʾnåm ūveqåråm vekhål-ʾasher låhem hēvîʾū
English: And the men are shepherds, for their trade hath been to feed cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כִּֽי־יִקְרָ֥א לָכֶ֖ם פַּרְעֹ֑ה וְאָמַ֖ר מַה־מַּעֲשֵׂיכֶֽם׃
Translit: vehåyåh kî-yiqråʾ låkhem parʿōh veʾåmar mah-maʿasēkhem
English: And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you, and shall say, What is your occupation?

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֗ם אַנְשֵׁ֨י מִקְנֶ֜ה הָי֤וּ עֲבָדֶ֨יךָ֙ מִנְּעוּרֵ֣ינוּ וְעַד־עַ֔תָּה גַּם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ גַּם־אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ בַּעֲב֗וּר תֵּשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן כִּֽי־תוֹעֲבַ֥ת מִצְרַ֖יִם כָּל־רֹ֥עֵה צֹֽאן׃
Translit: vaʾamartem ʾanshē miqneh håiū ʿavådhekhå minneʿūrēnū veʿadh-ʿattåh gam-ʾanaḥnū gam-ʾavōthēnū baʿavūr tēshevū beʾeretṣ gōshen kî-thōʿavath mitṣrayim kål-rōʿēh tṣōʾn
English: That ye shall say, Thy servants' trade hath been about cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination unto the Egyptians.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א יוֹסֵף֮ וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לְפַרְעֹה֒ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אָבִ֨י וְאַחַ֜י וְצֹאנָ֤ם וּבְקָרָם֙ וְכָל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֔ם בָּ֖אוּ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְהִנָּ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: vayyåvōʾ yōsēf vayyaggēdh lefarʿōh vayyōʾmer ʾåvî veʾaḥai vetṣōʾnåm ūveqåråm vekhål-ʾasher låhem båʾū mēʾeretṣ kenåʿan vehinnåm beʾeretṣ gōshen
English: Then Joseph came and told Pharaoh, and said, My father and my brethren, and their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have, are come out of the land of Canaan; and, behold, they are in the land of Goshen.

Hebrew: וּמִקְצֵ֣ה אֶחָ֔יו לָקַ֖ח חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּצִּגֵ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: ūmiqtṣēh ʾeḥåv låqaḥ ḥamisshåh ʾanåshîm vayyatṣṣighēm lifnē farʿōh
English: And he took some of his brethren, even five men, and presented them unto Pharaoh.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֛ה אֶל־אֶחָ֖יו מַה־מַּעֲשֵׂיכֶ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֗ה רֹעֵ֥ה צֹאן֙ עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ גַּם־אֲנַ֖חְנוּ גַּם־אֲבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer parʿōh ʾel-ʾeḥåv mah-maʿasēkhem vayyōʾmerū ʾel-parʿōh rōʿēh tṣōʾn ʿavådhekhå gam-ʾanaḥnū gam-ʾavōthēnū
English: And Pharaoh said unto his brethren, What is your occupation? And they said unto Pharaoh, Thy servants are shepherds, both we, and also our fathers.

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֗ה לָג֣וּר בָּאָרֶץ֮ בָּאנוּ֒ כִּי־אֵ֣ין מִרְעֶ֗ה לַצֹּאן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְעַתָּ֛ה יֵֽשְׁבוּ־נָ֥א עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גֹּֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: vayyōʾmerū ʾel-parʿōh låghūr båʾåretṣ båʾnū kî-ʾēn mirʿeh latṣṣōʾn ʾasher laʿavådhekhå kî-khåvēdh håråʿåv beʾeretṣ kenåʿan veʿattåh yēshevū-nåʾ ʿavådhekhå beʾeretṣ gōshen
English: They said moreover unto Pharaoh, For to sojourn in the land are we come; for thy servants have no pasture for their flocks; for the famine is sore in the land of Canaan: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy servants dwell in the land of Goshen.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֶל־יוֹסֵ֖ף לֵאמֹ֑ר אָבִ֥יךָ וְאַחֶ֖יךָ בָּ֥אוּ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer parʿōh ʾel-yōsēf lēʾmōr ʾåvîkhå veʾaḥekhå båʾū ʾēlekhå
English: And Pharaoh spake unto Joseph, saying, Thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee:

Hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ לְפָנֶ֣יךָ הִ֔וא בְּמֵיטַ֣ב הָאָ֔רֶץ הוֹשֵׁ֥ב אֶת־אָבִ֖יךָ וְאֶת־אַחֶ֑יךָ יֵשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֔שֶׁן וְאִם־יָדַ֗עְתָּ וְיֶשׁ־בָּם֙ אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֔יִל וְשַׂמְתָּ֛ם שָׂרֵ֥י מִקְנֶ֖ה עַל־אֲשֶׁר־לִֽי׃
Translit: ʾeretṣ mitṣrayim lefånekhå hivʾ bemēṭav håʾåretṣ hōshēv ʾeth-ʾåvîkhå veʾeth-ʾaḥekhå yēshevū beʾeretṣ gōshen veʾim-yådhaʿtå veyesh-båm ʾanshē-ḥayil vesamtåm sårē miqneh ʿal-ʾasher-lî
English: The land of Egypt is before thee; in the best of the land make thy father and brethren to dwell; in the land of Goshen let them dwell: and if thou knowest any men of activity among them, then make them rulers over my cattle.

Hebrew: וַיָּבֵ֤א יוֹסֵף֙ אֶת־יַֽעֲקֹ֣ב אָבִ֔יו וַיַּֽעֲמִדֵ֖הוּ לִפְנֵ֣י פַרְעֹ֑ה וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פַּרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyåvēʾ yōsēf ʾeth-yaʿaqōv ʾåvîv vayyaʿamidhēhū lifnē farʿōh vayvårekh yaʿaqōv ʾeth-parʿōh
English: And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh: and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר פַּרְעֹ֖ה אֶֽל־יַעֲקֹ֑ב כַּמָּ֕ה יְמֵ֖י שְׁנֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer parʿōh ʾel-yaʿaqōv kammåh yemē shenē ḥayyekhå
English: And Pharaoh said unto Jacob, How old art thou?

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יַעֲקֹב֙ אֶל־פַּרְעֹ֔ה יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵ֣י מְגוּרַ֔י שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה מְעַ֣ט וְרָעִ֗ים הָיוּ֙ יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵ֣י חַיַּ֔י וְלֹ֣א הִשִּׂ֗יגוּ אֶת־יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵי֙ חַיֵּ֣י אֲבֹתַ֔י בִּימֵ֖י מְגוּרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yaʿaqōv ʾel-parʿōh yemē shenē meghūrai shelōshîm ūmeʾath shånåh meʿaṭ veråʿîm håiū yemē shenē ḥayyai velōʾ hissîghū ʾeth-yemē shenē ḥayyē ʾavōthai bîmē meghūrēhem
English: And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The days of the years of my pilgrimage are an hundred and thirty years: few and evil have the days of the years of my life been, and have not attained unto the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֶת־פַּרְעֹ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֖א מִלִּפְנֵ֥י פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayvårekh yaʿaqōv ʾeth-parʿōh vayyētṣēʾ millifnē farʿōh
English: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from before Pharaoh.

Hebrew: וַיּוֹשֵׁ֣ב יוֹסֵף֮ אֶת־אָבִ֣יו וְאֶת־אֶחָיו֒ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֤ם אֲחֻזָּה֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בְּמֵיטַ֥ב הָאָ֖רֶץ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ רַעְמְסֵ֑ס כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyōshēv yōsēf ʾeth-ʾåvîv veʾeth-ʾeḥåv vayyittēn låhem ʾaḥuzzåh beʾeretṣ mitṣrayim bemēṭav håʾåretṣ beʾeretṣ raʿmesēs kaʾasher tṣivvåh farʿōh
English: And Joseph placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.

Hebrew: וַיְכַלְכֵּ֤ל יוֹסֵף֙ אֶת־אָבִ֣יו וְאֶת־אֶחָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת כָּל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יו לֶ֖חֶם לְפִ֥י הַטָּֽף׃
Translit: vaykhalkēl yōsēf ʾeth-ʾåvîv veʾeth-ʾeḥåv veʾēth kål-bēth ʾåvîv leḥem lefî haṭṭåf
English: And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father's household, with bread, according to their families.

Hebrew: וְלֶ֤חֶם אֵין֙ בְּכָל־הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּֽי־כָבֵ֥ד הָרָעָ֖ב מְאֹ֑ד וַתֵּ֜לַהּ אֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ וְאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן מִפְּנֵ֖י הָרָעָֽב׃
Translit: veleḥem ʾēn bekhål-håʾåretṣ kî-khåvēdh håråʿåv meʾōdh vattēlahh ʾeretṣ mitṣrayim veʾeretṣ kenaʿan mippenē håråʿåv
English: And there was no bread in all the land; for the famine was very sore, so that the land of Egypt and all the land of Canaan fainted by reason of the famine.

Hebrew: וַיְלַקֵּ֣ט יוֹסֵ֗ף אֶת־כָּל־הַכֶּ֨סֶף֙ הַנִּמְצָ֤א בְאֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ וּבְאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בַּשֶּׁ֖בֶר אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣ם שֹׁבְרִ֑ים וַיָּבֵ֥א יוֹסֵ֛ף אֶת־הַכֶּ֖סֶף בֵּ֥יתָה פַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vaylaqqēṭ yōsēf ʾeth-kål-hakkesef hannimtṣåʾ veʾeretṣ-mitṣrayim ūveʾeretṣ kenaʿan basshever ʾasher-hēm shōverîm vayyåvēʾ yōsēf ʾeth-hakkesef bēthåh farʿōh
English: And Joseph gathered up all the money that was found in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, for the corn which they bought: and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh's house.

Hebrew: וַיִּתֹּ֣ם הַכֶּ֗סֶף מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַיִם֮ וּמֵאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַעַן֒ וַיָּבֹאוּ֩ כָל־מִצְרַ֨יִם אֶל־יוֹסֵ֤ף לֵאמֹר֙ הָֽבָה־לָּ֣נוּ לֶ֔חֶם וְלָ֥מָּה נָמ֖וּת נֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י אָפֵ֖ס כָּֽסֶף׃

English: And when money failed in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came unto Joseph, and said, Give us bread: for why should we die in thy presence? for the money faileth.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ הָב֣וּ מִקְנֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם בְּמִקְנֵיכֶ֑ם אִם־אָפֵ֖ס כָּֽסֶף׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yōsēf håvū miqnēkhem veʾettenåh låkhem bemiqnēkhem ʾim-ʾåfēs kåsef
English: And Joseph said, Give your cattle; and I will give you for your cattle, if money fail.

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֣יאוּ אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶם֮ אֶל־יוֹסֵף֒ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָהֶם֩ יוֹסֵ֨ף לֶ֜חֶם בַּסּוּסִ֗ים וּבְמִקְנֵ֥ה הַצֹּ֛אן וּבְמִקְנֵ֥ה הַבָּקָ֖ר וּבַחֲמֹרִ֑ים וַיְנַהֲלֵ֤ם בַּלֶּ֨חֶם֙ בְּכָל־מִקְנֵהֶ֔ם בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַהִֽוא׃

English: And they brought their cattle unto Joseph: and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for horses, and for the flocks, and for the cattle of the herds, and for the asses: and he fed them with bread for all their cattle for that year.

Hebrew: וַתִּתֹּם֮ הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַהִוא֒ וַיָּבֹ֨אוּ אֵלָ֜יו בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית וַיֹּ֤אמְרוּ לוֹ֙ לֹֽא־נְכַחֵ֣ד מֵֽאֲדֹנִ֔י כִּ֚י אִם־תַּ֣ם הַכֶּ֔סֶף וּמִקְנֵ֥ה הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֑י לֹ֤א נִשְׁאַר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י בִּלְתִּ֥י אִם־גְּוִיָּתֵ֖נוּ וְאַדְמָתֵֽנוּ׃
Translit: vattittōm hasshånåh hahivʾ vayyåvōʾū ʾēlåv basshånåh hasshēnîth vayyōʾmerū lō lōʾ-nekhaḥēdh mēʾadhōnî kî ʾim-tam hakkesef ūmiqnēh habbehēmåh ʾel-ʾadhōnî lōʾ nishʾar lifnē ʾadhōnî biltî ʾim-geviyyåthēnū veʾadhmåthēnū
English: When that year was ended, they came unto him the second year, and said unto him, We will not hide it from my lord, how that our money is spent; my lord also hath our herds of cattle; there is not ought left in the sight of my lord, but our bodies, and our lands:

Hebrew: לָ֧מָּה נָמ֣וּת לְעֵינֶ֗יךָ גַּם־אֲנַ֨חְנוּ֙ גַּ֣ם אַדְמָתֵ֔נוּ קְנֵֽה־אֹתָ֥נוּ וְאֶת־אַדְמָתֵ֖נוּ בַּלָּ֑חֶם וְנִֽהְיֶ֞ה אֲנַ֤חְנוּ וְאַדְמָתֵ֨נוּ֙ עֲבָדִ֣ים לְפַרְעֹ֔ה וְתֶן־זֶ֗רַע וְנִֽחְיֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א נָמ֔וּת וְהָאֲדָמָ֖ה לֹ֥א תֵשָֽׁם׃
Translit: låmmåh nåmūth leʿēnekhå gam-ʾanaḥnū gam ʾadhmåthēnū qenēh-ʾōthånū veʾeth-ʾadhmåthēnū ballåḥem venihyeh ʾanaḥnū veʾadhmåthēnū ʿavådhîm lefarʿōh vethen-zeraʿ veniḥyeh velōʾ nåmūth vehåʾadhåmåh lōʾ thēshåm
English: Wherefore shall we die before thine eyes, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants unto Pharaoh: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, that the land be not desolate.

Hebrew: וַיִּ֨קֶן יוֹסֵ֜ף אֶת־כָּל־אַדְמַ֤ת מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ לְפַרְעֹ֔ה כִּֽי־מָכְר֤וּ מִצְרַ֨יִם֙ אִ֣ישׁ שָׂדֵ֔הוּ כִּֽי־חָזַ֥ק עֲלֵהֶ֖ם הָרָעָ֑ב וַתְּהִ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyiqen yōsēf ʾeth-kål-ʾadhmath mitṣrayim lefarʿōh kî-måkhrū mitṣrayim ʾîsh sådhēhū kî-ḥåzaq ʿalēhem håråʿåv vattehî håʾåretṣ lefarʿōh
English: And Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh; for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine prevailed over them: so the land became Pharaoh's.

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־הָעָ֔ם הֶעֱבִ֥יר אֹת֖וֹ לֶעָרִ֑ים מִקְצֵ֥ה גְבוּל־מִצְרַ֖יִם וְעַד־קָצֵֽהוּ׃
Translit: veʾeth-håʿåm heʿevîr ʾōthō leʿårîm miqtṣēh ghevūl-mitṣrayim veʿadh-qåtṣēhū
English: And as for the people, he removed them to cities from one end of the borders of Egypt even to the other end thereof.

Hebrew: רַ֛ק אַדְמַ֥ת הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים לֹ֣א קָנָ֑ה כִּי֩ חֹ֨ק לַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים מֵאֵ֣ת פַּרְעֹ֗ה וְאָֽכְל֤וּ אֶת־חֻקָּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן לָהֶם֙ פַּרְעֹ֔ה עַל־כֵּ֕ן לֹ֥א מָכְר֖וּ אֶת־אַדְמָתָֽם׃
Translit: raq ʾadhmath hakkōhanîm lōʾ qånåh kî ḥōq lakkōhanîm mēʾēth parʿōh veʾåkhlū ʾeth-ḥuqqåm ʾasher nåthan låhem parʿōh ʿal-kēn lōʾ måkhrū ʾeth-ʾadhmåthåm
English: Only the land of the priests bought he not; for the priests had a portion assigned them of Pharaoh, and did eat their portion which Pharaoh gave them: wherefore they sold not their lands.

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹסֵף֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם הֵן֩ קָנִ֨יתִי אֶתְכֶ֥ם הַיּ֛וֹם וְאֶת־אַדְמַתְכֶ֖ם לְפַרְעֹ֑ה הֵֽא־לָכֶ֣ם זֶ֔רַע וּזְרַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmer yōsēf ʾel-håʿåm hēn qånîthî ʾethkhem hayyōm veʾeth-ʾadhmathkhem lefarʿōh hēʾ-låkhem zeraʿ ūzeraʿtem ʾeth-håʾadhåmåh
English: Then Joseph said unto the people, Behold, I have bought you this day and your land for Pharaoh: lo, here is seed for you, and ye shall sow the land.

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בַּתְּבוּאֹ֔ת וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם חֲמִישִׁ֖ית לְפַרְעֹ֑ה וְאַרְבַּ֣ע הַיָּדֹ֡ת יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶם֩ לְזֶ֨רַע הַשָּׂדֶ֧ה וּֽלְאָכְלְכֶ֛ם וְלַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּבָתֵּיכֶ֖ם וְלֶאֱכֹ֥ל לְטַפְּכֶֽם׃
Translit: vehåyåh battevūʾōth ūnethattem ḥamîshîth lefarʿōh veʾarbaʿ hayyådhōth yihyeh låkhem lezeraʿ hassådheh ūleʾåkhlekhem velaʾasher bevåttēkhem veleʾekhōl leṭappekhem
English: And it shall come to pass in the increase, that ye shall give the fifth part unto Pharaoh, and four parts shall be your own, for seed of the field, and for your food, and for them of your households, and for food for your little ones.

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ הֶחֱיִתָ֑נוּ נִמְצָא־חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י וְהָיִ֥ינוּ עֲבָדִ֖ים לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyōʾmerū heḥeyithånū nimtṣåʾ-ḥēn beʿēnē ʾadhōnî vehåyînū ʿavådhîm lefarʿōh
English: And they said, Thou hast saved our lives: let us find grace in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh's servants.

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שֶׂם אֹתָ֣הּ יוֹסֵ֡ף לְחֹק֩ עַד־הַיּ֨וֹם הַזֶּ֜ה עַל־אַדְמַ֥ת מִצְרַ֛יִם לְפַרְעֹ֖ה לַחֹ֑מֶשׁ רַ֞ק אַדְמַ֤ת הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ לְבַדָּ֔ם לֹ֥א הָיְתָ֖ה לְפַרְעֹֽה׃
Translit: vayyåsem ʾōthåhh yōsēf leḥōq ʿadh-hayyōm hazzeh ʿal-ʾadhmath mitṣrayim lefarʿōh laḥōmesh raq ʾadhmath hakkōhanîm levaddåm lōʾ håythåh lefarʿōh
English: And Joseph made it a law over the land of Egypt unto this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth part; except the land of the priests only, which became not Pharaoh's.

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ גֹּ֑שֶׁן וַיֵּאָחֲז֣וּ בָ֔הּ וַיִּפְר֥וּ וַיִּרְבּ֖וּ מְאֹֽד׃
Translit: vayyēshev yisråʾēl beʾeretṣ mitṣrayim beʾeretṣ gōshen vayyēʾåḥazū våhh vayyifrū vayyirbū meʾōdh
English: And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the country of Goshen; and they had possessions therein, and grew, and multiplied exceedingly.
